questionText: Internationally there are far more orphans than adoptive parents.
author: A22VACRM9GC73M

questionText: The UN Hague Convention treaty was approved by US Congress in 2000.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: The UN Hague Convention on International Adoptions offered guidelines for reform.
author: A2YKW761AK4ZGY

questionText: Russia and China have been amending their laws to prevent abuses in adoptions.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: In July 2000, the US ratified the Hague Convention on Intercountry Adoption.
author: AC5UD8N187QD6

questionText: The United States has ratified the Convention.
author: A2Q3FS9G8ITCN7

questionText: The Hague Convention on Intercountry Adoption, which was created to harmonize the adoption practices of different countries.
author: A1C0H8G0YI15MN

questionText: In 1999, 16,396 adopted children came to the US from abroad.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C

questionText: Cultural awareness events and support groups are being formed in the US for adoptive parents.
author: A2IU5TX5S0FA1C
